author: Adam Carlson
title: Utah Man Killed in London Terror Attack While Celebrating Wedding Anniversary: Reports
text:
A Utah husband and wife celebrating their 25th wedding anniversary are among the victims of Wednesday’s terror attack near U.K. Parliament in London, according to multiple reports .
Husband Kurt Cochran died in the car and knife assault, his family said in a statement, according to a KSL reporter . Wife Melissa also “received serious injures” and has been hospitalized, the family said.
The couple had traveled to Europe to celebrate thei anniversary and were planning to return home on Thursday — one day after the violence, according to KSL.
“Our family is heartbroken,” the family said in its statement.
“Kurt was a good man and a loving husband,” they said, adding, “We express our gratitude to the emergency and medical personnel who have cared for them and ask for your prayers on behalf of Melissa and our family.”
The BBC and KSTU confirmed Kurt’s death and Melissa’s injuries.
Relatives told the station that Kurt died Thursday morning and that the couple was on a “dream vacation,” traveling to Germany and Austria as well as Britain.
They were on Westminster Bridge Wednesday afternoon when an armed attacker plowed through dozens of pedestrians in an SUV, according to KTSU. The attacker than crashed into a gate near the Palace of Westminster and fatally stabbed a police officer, authorities said.
Five people were killed, including the assailant and officer, and 40 more were injured, including an American.
Other victims include a mom of two who was killed while heading to pick up her daughters from school.
PEOPLE could not immediately reach the Cochran family; London police and the U.S. Embassy could not confirm if they were among the casualties.
British Prime Minster Theresa May said that the attacker, who has not been identified, was born in Britain and was “once investigated in relation to concerns about violent extremism.”
A Twitter account associated with ISIS has claimed responsibility.
• With reporting by PHIL BOUCHER
